thread.section_title: WSJ Life, Style & Arts: Weekend News and Reads
thread.title: Life Beyond the Three-Ring Circus

author: Amanda Foreman
title: Life Beyond the Three-Ring Circus
text:
The modern circus, which celebrates its 250th anniversary this year, has attracted such famous fans as Queen Victoria, Charles Dickens and Ernest Hemingway, who wrote in 1953, “It’s the only spectacle I know that, while you watch it, gives the quality of a truly happy dream.”
Recently, however, the “happy dream” has struggled with lawsuits, high-profile bankruptcies and killer clown scares inspired in part by the evil Pennywise in Stephen King’s “It.” Even the new Hugh Jackman-led circus film, “The Greatest Showman,” comes...
